perturbation.original_text: THIS AGREEMENT is made and entered into this 1st day of June, 2017 by and between Prudential Bank (hereinafter referred to as the "Employer"), located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Jeffrey Hanuscin, (hereinafter referred to as the "Employee"), residing at 2406 Sanibel Circle, Palmyra, NJ 08065.
perturbation.changed_text: THIS AGREEMENT is made and entered into this 1st day of June, 2017 by and between Prudential Bank (hereinafter referred to as the "Company"), located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Jeffrey Hanuscin, (hereinafter referred to as the "Associate"), residing at 2406 Sanibel Circle, Palmyra, NJ 08065.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Employer' and 'Employee' are replaced with 'Company' and 'Associate' respectively. This creates confusion as later sections refer to 'Employer' and 'Employee', making it unclear if the agreement still applies to the same entities.

perturbation.original_text:
ARTICLE IV "Rights to the Proceeds at Death"

Upon the death of the Employee while this Agreement is in force, the Employee's beneficiary as named in the Beneficiary Designation Form on page 6 (or as it may be amended according to the terms set forth on page 6) for this Agreement will be entitled to receive from the Policy proceeds an amount equal to the lesser of: (a) (two (2) times the Employee's annualized base salary at the time of death as provided by the Employer's payroll department) plus $100,000, reduced by any amount payable under the Employer's group term life insurance plan, or (b) the Net Amount At Risk. The Employer shall be the beneficiary of the remaining death proceeds of the policy after the Employee's interest is determined. Within 60 days after the death of the Employee, the Employer will provide to the "Insurer" a written statement indicating the amount of each policy's proceeds the Employee's beneficiary is entitled to receive.
perturbation.changed_text:
ARTICLE IV "Rights to the Proceeds at Death"

Upon the death of the Associate while this Agreement is in force, the Associate's beneficiary as named in the Beneficiary Designation Form on page 6 (or as it may be amended according to the terms set forth on page 6) for this Agreement will be entitled to receive from the Policy proceeds an amount equal to the lesser of: (a) (two (2) times the Associate's annualized base compensation at the time of death as provided by the Company's payroll department) plus $100,000, reduced by any amount payable under the Company's group term life insurance plan, or (b) the Net Amount At Risk. The Employer shall be the beneficiary of the remaining death proceeds of the policy after the Employee's interest is determined. Within 60 days after the death of the Employee, the Employer will provide to the "Insurer" a written statement indicating the amount of each policy's proceeds the Employee's beneficiary is entitled to receive.
perturbation.explanation: In Article IV, I changed the 'Employee' to 'Associate' and 'Employer' to 'Company' to be consistent with the change in the preamble. However, I also left the terms 'Employee' and 'Employer' to create a contradictory meaning within the same article. Also the 'base salary' was changed to 'base compensation'.

perturbation.original_text:
ARTICLE VIII "Claims Procedure"

(1) Filing claims. Any insured, beneficiary or other individual (hereinafter "Claimant") entitled to benefits under the Plan or under the Policies will file a Claim request with the Plan Administrator with respect to benefits under the Plan and with the "Insurer", with respect to benefits under the Policies. The Plan Administrator will, upon written request of a Claimant, make available copies of any claim forms or instructions provided by the "Insurer" or advise the Claimant where such forms or instructions may be obtained.
perturbation.changed_text:
ARTICLE VIII "Claims Procedure"

(1) Filing claims. Any insured, beneficiary or other individual (hereinafter "Claimant") entitled to benefits under the Program or under the Policies will file a Claim request with the Benefits Coordinator with respect to benefits under the Program and with the "Insurer", with respect to benefits under the Policies. The Program Coordinator will, upon written request of a Claimant, make available copies of any claim forms or instructions provided by the "Insurer" or advise the Claimant where such forms or instructions may be obtained.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Plan' and 'Plan Administrator' are replaced with 'Program' and 'Benefits Coordinator' respectively. The contract later uses 'Plan Administrator' without defining it, creating a conflict.
